context.p: Users can generate API keys and set the expiration dates for different user accounts to enhance account management efficiency.

step.cmd: Log on to the web console using an account with the Admin role.

li.p: The logon credentials entered here are case-sensitive.

step.cmd: Under the Users tab, find the user ID you want to modify and go to the kebab menu under Actions at the right of the screen.
Click on the kebab menu, and then select the Generate API Key option.
The Generate API Key window appears. Click the date picker and choose an expiration date on the pop-up calendar. Click Confirm.
An API key is generated. Click the clipboard for copying the generated API key.

note.p: Make sure to back up the copied API key before proceeding to the next step. The API key will not be displayed again for security reason.

step.cmd: Check the result under API Key Expiry Date for the result or mouse hover above the kebab menu of the user account, and the expiration date of the API key will appear.
